column5: Trying to find a plating shop that will do small orders for a reasonable price. My Daughter has a friend who is making some fishing spoons as wedding gifts for the people attending their wedding. The fellow is hoping to make about a hundred (100) and get them done in either chrome, or something similar.  Anyone have any ideas?  Thanks, Brian
Look into powder coating them.Good durable finish will last for years. Joe

Superior Metal Finishing in London does spoons and plugs for Linquist Brothers (Canadian Wiggler and Cisco spoons).  They are one of my customers, I can check out how much it would cost to get them done.  Burt
Can I go to the wedding???
Thanks Burt! That would be perfect...since the fellow making them is in Woodstock!  Good idea on the powder coating Joe. Might be an alternative if the plating cannot happen.
